Posts.Content: Hubby shocked the hell out of me with his pressy this year. As I hadnt been working much this year we decided on just a small gift to each other cos we wanted the children to continue normal Christmas stuff so money being tight I didnt mind. BUT!! On Christmas morning after all the pressies were opened I was sitting with big grin in my face so happy the kids were happy when what did he carry in only the tiniest pomeranian puppy I ever saw ! Soooo cute !! We have called her Missy & she is adorable but a pain in the butt trying to train her to do her business outside ha ha ha !! So that was a huge surprise for me !Hope Santa was good to you all & I just wanted to wish each & everyone of you a really really happy new year with only good times ahead... I know you are all on the same bus getting off at different stops but the day will finally come when we dont need to get on any fecking bus !!!!! Take care all of you lovely ladies one & all, & heres to sticking two fat fingers in the face of the Big C !! Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hi Carol, Im thinking of calling Missy... Pissy Shitty Missy instead !! She is sooo bold ! Between hubby me & 2 kids we all take turns taking her outside where she has great freedom to do what needs to be done at least 8 times a day as recommended. This can last at least 20/30 mins at a time which believe me does not go down well !! Anyway she does nowt outside even though encouraged to go to toilet !! BUT as soon as she is back indoors she poops or pees unknown to anyone the wee maggot !! Oh its just so annoying especially when Im getting on with other things while hubby & kids are just watching tv or on laptop or PS3... aaarrrggghhhh !! BUT i love her to bits so getting a man over on Sat to help me as Im back to work full time now ... Aw the joys ha ha xxx As for the walking she is sooo tiny that just going to the piers & back she falls asleep as she only 7 weeks old ... STILL a wee maggot !! Ha ha ...Patricia xx
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hi Debs, I had mastectomy with immediate LD flap recon so I cant say what the difference is but I can share what I went through. I spent 6 days in hospital & got the last of my 4 drains removed the morning I was discharged. I was up and about the day I came home but please please do take it easy & one day at a time. Each day you will find yourself getting stronger, but rest will help you recover. Avoid lifting anything heavy and if you have to lift something from the floor be sure to get down on your hunkers to do it dont bend over as this will put pressure on your wound. I wish you the very best of luck with your procedure & speedy recovery. Will include you in my prayers as I do with all my BC buddies on here.Take care & dont forget to take it easy... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: reconstruction - using the tram flap method - anyone can reassure...

Posts.Content: Hi all... If its not bad enough to go through full mastectomy, complete lymph node removal & ld flap reconstruction - then the chemo & radiotherapy still to come - How long do you suffer all the recovery of pain from surgery. The tightness in my back, under arm & chest is unreal. I had my op on 26th April & have had twinges of pain up to today. I went back to work today - sitting at desk with wonderful boss so did not get up to much believe me - the only way I can explain the sensations Im feeling is as if a baby is kicking around my scars, not all the time on & off but with a tightening hot feeling. Is this normal ? How long will it go on ? I have no patience for being off work as I would end up getting treatment for my head instead of the "C". Has anyone else had this or am I being a real wuss ?
Posts.Title: How long of a recovery time from op ????

Posts.Content: Hi Kate, thanks for your reply. It just gets so flipping frustrating. You try & get your head around all the procedures ( although I really did not want to know - I just told my consultant to get the wee f****er out & kick it around the place & then set fire to it!! - seriously I did ) So my main concern at the time was just to get all out of me & that was as far I could deal with at the time. Now my head is telling my body to cop on that all is gone & I should be back to normal now but Im not. The healing pains which I have decided to call them can be horrendous at times. I did look it up here on the site & seemingly all the nerves are starting to work again & that can cause all the shootings of pain. I just did not prepare myself for all the healing. My consultant -WHO IS MY GOD, A FANTASTIC MAN WITH WONDERFUL HEALING HANDS, I HAVE BEEN TOTALLY BLESSED TO HAVE HIM - did stress how huge the surgery would be so I guess theres not much else I can do now but (inwardly scream!!!) wait with frustration. Sorry about the rant - Im preparing myself for a good day so all the bad thoughts are gone ! Thanks xxx
Posts.Title: How long of a recovery time from op ????

Posts.Content: Good Morning clh1973,Thanks for your reply. Its good to chat with someone who has been on the same road as me. Its just you know when you get a pain - you kind of think, well is this normal? Am I suppossed to be getting these horrendous pains? I was telling Kate there I have decided to call them my "Healing Pains" to comfort me.. ha ha ha !! Your experience sounds exactly like what I have but some of my sharp pains would make me hold my breath. I dont so much have pain in the new boob more like weird weird sensations) it is mostly all in my back which feels like Im the hunchback of Notre Dam. Sometimes I even strip in the bathroom to look at my back because it feels so weird I get convinced it is going to look weird. Hope we can keep in touch now that I know we are on the same road, even though your a right few miles ahead of me - good to know your here to let me know about the journey. Thanks so much xxxx
Posts.Title: How long of a recovery time from op ????

Posts.Content: Hi Kirstie Second day of work over & I loved getting back in to the thick of things, It really has lifted my spirits. I havent plucked the courage up yet to get behind the wheel as the pain in my back is still so sore. Physio rang me today so Ive an appt with them on Thursday - could not have come at better time as Im away for the weekend at a wedding so well pleased :) I just got the most weird sensation in my new boob - it felt like it done a bellpy flop, I actually looked down my top to see if it had fell out.. ha ha ha... Seriously I hope that is not serious .. Is It ??? Ohh.. paranoia now.. Im sitting here modelling my new wig which to be honest looked a lot better in the shop :( Hubby thinks Im not wise sitting wearing it while Im blessed to still have full head of hair but am thinking Im breaking in gradually to the idea. How long after all your treatments did your hair start growing back? Take care & chat to you soon xxx
Posts.Title: How long of a recovery time from op ????

Posts.Content: Hey Kirstie, I do the physio every day & they rang me today so go in on Thursday which is great. You are so right about the normality end of things. I think Im getting a bit additcted to this website though as I check in every morning & every night - my new facebook ! ha ha ha. It is just so good to come on here & share your fears knowing some one has already battled them & are here to offer their advice & experiences. When you see what some people have come through I feel a bit of a wuss for gurning on ! Have a lovely week & speak to you soon xx
Posts.Title: How long of a recovery time from op ????

Posts.Content: Hey Kevtaxi - all that you are experiencing is totally normal believe me. I have had that and then some. We get really low then beat ourselves up thinking we are feeling sorry for ourselves but we are not we are just learning to cope with all the massive changes that are going on in our life that we have no control over. If you can try & put all out of your head until results day because worrying yourself sick is not going to change anything that will be said to you on that day. I hope it is as good as can be expected for you but Chemo & Rads are just another form of kicking cancers butt & sticking 2 fat fingers up in its face ! Dont be worrying over something you have absolutely no control over as it is doing you no good at all. Go out have more fun with your family but take it easy as well... Whatever your outcome, I wish you the very best of luck on your journey. Its a big bus we are all on, just getting off at different stops but the destination is the same for us all.. Healthy normal cancer free life again ! So remember, there are lots of us on here that will give you the support you need. God knows only for this site I really dont know where I would have ended up - everyone is so understanding & offers lots of kindness & support when needed. So chin up girly, we will help you along the way.. Take care pet & let us know how you get on..... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: had a good day now down

Posts.Content: Aw Babs, your poor wee pet. Sending you a big tight squeeeeezey hug just for you! What your feeling is totally normal. We have all been there believe me. Its so much better to let it all out & in a way better if there is no-one around. I was alone one day in the house & I actually howled like an animal I swear it came from my big toe right out my mouth. It was the best thing I could have done. I had a lot of anger building up inside me & like you when others were around I was fine but once alone BANG!! Have a good old cry, scream, shout, howl, do whatever makes you feel better & gives you some release pet. Aw my heart goes out to you, but this is a wonderful place to voice your anger & concerns as we are all on the same bus just getting off at different stops. So, remember - really your never alone when you come on here... You have all of us to help each other. I have had great help on here & all the gals are all so wonderfully kind & thoughtful. Dont be worrying about the drain - it will sort itself out. Just because people say you are strong doesnt mean that you have to be like that all the time - I kept getting txt messages saying that as well & I felt like firing the phone at the wall. It is okay to cry, it is okay to feel like sh1t... Just be sure to talk it through - even on here. Dont let it get in on you. You take care lovey & will say a wee prayer that you WILL get through this,.. Lots of love & hugs, Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: had a nice weekend but feeling realy low today

Posts.Content: I remember when I was diagnosed last March a lovely friend (NOT!!) said to me aw sure think of all the weight you will lose !!! Well, I think my body decided to prove her wrong! Im not on tamoxifen, though had mx, full node clearance, ld flap recon, 6 x chemo & 25 x rads - all finishing on 2nd Nov. Since being diagoniosed I gave up the dirty fags (which I was only smoking around 5 a day .. I know it doesnt matter how many but trying to take the bad look of it all) So gave them up at the same time & have since put on almost 3 stone being the heaviest I have ever ever been in my life ( even when pregnant with twins !!! )  I googled weight gain with breast cancer & they sait its very common to put weight on in face, neck & belly which is exactly where it has went on,, well okay has went on everywhere but most noticeable where I have said !! I am now suffering terribly with neuropathic pain in my feet which at night time is horrendous at times. I do not want to go on even more meds for this as Dr Google has told me the norm meds for this is anti-depressants / epilepsy meds - dont get me wrong absolutley nothing wrong with these meds but I really want to get all the poison out of me now not pump more in. I am taking Glucosamine + Chondroitin, Omega 3 & Calicum + Vit D religiously since I stopped rads & have been fine up until last week when I seem to be going down hill. My scars are all really painful all the time, my arm aches even though Im doing the exercises religiously every day - it just seems to be that life is going backwards. I plan on doing the mini marathon in June to give me something positive to achieve this year & I really dont want the hassle of all the crap again ! Now, Im getting paranoid ! I did see my surgeon (my hero !!) at teh end of Nov & he was so pleased but have not got any appt yet to see Onc or a follow up scan. Am I being a spoilt little brat ?? I have had one period since the chemo started as well. Aaaarrrggggggghhhhhh !!!!  Screeeeeeeeeeeeeeaaam !! Want to just cry. Hit the booze a few nights as well just to block it all out ! Im so pissed off that Im even feeling like this !! I do not want to let the tramp get in on me again ! Been there done that got the boob off to prove it ! Why oh why does it still niggle at me like an annoying itch !!! Sooo sorry for the rant ! Has anyone else had this pain or have become as huge as me !! Sooo feeling sorry for myself.. Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny Rads can really beat us up ! So Id say thats what it is... I did (Still do) suffer real tightness under my arm & down my arm a bit like someone was constantly nipping me ( only problem was there was no one I could clip round the lugs for doing it !! Arrgh ) But if you have any concerns that are on going I would get on to your Onc who will ease your worries for you pet.. Im sure its just side effects from the rads which I find just 2 months on... Not sure when you finished .....Remember our bodies have been through sheer hell & need time to recover from it all .. glass of wine or four might help ha ha ha !!! I take it from the nipple pain that you had a lumpectomy not a full Mx... Hope your starting to feel better xxxx Patricia. xx
Posts.Title: Fluid / Lymphodema in my breast

Posts.Content: Hello lovely ladies, Pleas
Posts.Title: Numb feet??

Posts.Content: Hello all my lovely friends - I dont be on here much anymore but I do follow all your progress by email alerts so I have not forgotten any of you. I laugh & I cry with you all as I read the posts.  I just wanted to come on & thank you all - every single one of you - for virtually holding my hand through the tough journey we are all on. I have finished all treatments on 2nd Nov - no further meds for me thank God. So the little fecker is gone to burn in hell !!!! Yes its gone to infinity & beyond !! Its been a mad whirlwind rollercoaster that I am very thankful to have gotten off! So, I just want to wish you all a fabulous Chirstmas & a wonderful cancer free 2013 !! I will toast you all on New Years Eve wishing you all good health, love & luck. You have all been here for me sharing a joke but more importantly sharing a tear - when no-one understood me or when I didnt understand me I came on here & spilled it all out & you were all soooo kind to me helping me through it all - you all know who you are my lovelies. So, thank you to you all... I am so proud of you all being so strong & flying the flag high for all the wonderful women kickinig cancers butt. You are all amazing xxx ooo Much love always & I will be praying for you all. May Santa be good to you all & may your angels always watch over you Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: To Infinity & Beyyyyyyond !!

Posts.Content: Oh Sweet Divine ! I just typed a heap of stuff there & thats what just appeared... Pleeeeeeease !! So now I have to rant & rave all over again.. So was going to say AGAIN.. please excuse any mistakes as Im on my 2nd glass ( by the way I have just poured my 3rd but had to stay true & type what I did at the start ha ha ha) & what does it do posts have a fecking word ! Oh my God !! The wine must be stronger than I thought.. So, I finished the Tax on 11th Sep & 25 rads on 2nd Nov & I too had the horrible numb feet/toes & real achey feet so done bit of research & am almost finished second dose of the following.. Glucosamine + Choindroitin / Calcium + Vit D / Omega 3 & I have to say it has all really helped me. The numbness only now comes on the balls of my feet if Im really on my feet all the time say out shopping for the day but defo improved from looking like a 90 year old getting out of bed. They did advise only 1 a day of all of the tabs as they said being only 41 that would be fine... Just watching Gary Barlow on itv+1... so easy on the eye... hhhhmmmm (yes hubbys in bed ha ha ) So hope this helps lovely ladies but best to check with GP first...So stay strong, pretty & stubborn to kick Big C's fat butt this year ! We will not stand for it !! Lots of love always to you all.. Patricia xoxox
Posts.Title: Numb feet??

Posts.Content: Hi Jelly, I have been where you are & have my last Docetaxol on Tuesday. IT IS ALL DO-ABLE.... However we are all different so s/e's will be different for each one of us so all we can do is share our experiences so we can compare. For me the 1st round was physically tough with the 2nd one being emotionally tough. Furry tongue & no taste are a bummer for me ! Get Nystatin drops for your mouth as you may get oral thrush. I had to get the Canesten Oral Capsule as well which I took on the Thursday *had chemo on Tues* as it will literally happen over night !! Hot flushes were & still are a bloody pain !! Pineapple & strawberries chilled are good food as I could not taste anything! Carbs were a no no for me. Plenty of water as well. I read somewhere if you suck ice / ice lollies / ice pops during the administration of the drug is helps ease the sore mouth. I still got it but not as bad as first time but it could have been cos I was using the Nystatin from the day after so its hard to know. All I can say to put it all in a nut shell is we just have to take it as it comes... Que sera sera.... I think we get to grips with it all just as its all ending. I did go on a downer on Tax 2 (chemo 5) but that could have been me !! Well, best of luck on your journey I sincerely hope you can handle it all & its not too tough on you... Best of luck pet & lots of hugs & dont be too frightened .. It is al do-able & that is the important thing ! Chemo kills Cancer ;) Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: T Tips Please

Posts.Content: Hi Kittycat, Children are a lot stronger than we think & actually a lot more mature than we give them credit for. I was dreading telling our 12 yr old twins (boy & girl) but I just blurted it out. No fancy frills, just said the medicine would make it fall out but that it was a really good sign as that proved the medicine was working - I never mentioned "C" word either - just bad cells that had to be removed. They seemed to have accepted that. I made it fun with the wig - getting them to try it on & making sure there were lots of laughs about it. Now they pass no remarks - they have even come up to me in the room to say we have visitors & dont forget to put your hair on ! Ha ha... Though I do wear a scarf around the house. So I think if you keep it upbeat & make a laugh out of it with them they will handle it - I think the way they handle it reflects on how you handle it. If they see you making no big deal about it they will think the same. I lay awake nights worrying about it before hand & when I done it I felt so silly for feeling so scared ! I really hope all goes well for you Kittycat - Big hugs going your way xxx Patricia xx
Posts.Title: Telling Young Children About Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Hey Jackson, If you had same s/e's as me on T which were horrid then Im jsut guessing that FEC will be good to you please God !! Glad you have the worst over you xxx Oh before I head off to bed, did I tell you my LAST CHEMO is next Tuesday ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha !! Sweet Dreams To All My Lovely Buddies xxxx
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, Just a quick q for you... Has anyone suffered from really watery eyes since going on Docetaxol ? I am due my 3rd & FINAL Chemo .. yes my FINAL Chemo on Tuesday & this past few days my left eye constantly runs, the right eye is a little watery but nothing like the left eye ! Any eye make up I wear to make me healthy looking is gone by lunch time so I look not half bad on what side & like deaths door on the other side of my face, I was just wondering is there anything I can take to help this. It was so bad in work today boss thought I was crying.. it literally just keeps running down my face.. MAD !!!
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: OMG !!! Sue !! I am exactly the same with the nose as well... Really dry & scabby & soooo tempting to pick all the time ha ha !! Oh this is mad carry on I can tell ya !! How ya getting on with the s/e's this time Sue seeing its your last one I hope they are manageable for you. WELL DONE YOU ON LAST CHEMO !!! Lucky divil ya... ha ha !! Did I say I have my last chemo next Tuesday, yep !! LAST CHEMO NEXT TUESDAY !!! Aw no Kittycat !! Cant believe you have suffered so long with this ! That is awful. Cant believe there is nothing that can sort it for you, is there someone you could go to for 2nd opinion ?? Must suss out that spray from Urban Decay - Im a real sucker for all that stuff !!! Thanks for that.. hope your keeping good girly, I have my last chemo on Tuesday - just incase you didnt know like I just wanted to let you know .. yeahhh LAST CHEMO NEXT TUESDAY !!! Lol !! Gee Jackson its mad the way only one eye has it so bad ! Had you Docetaxol first and then FEC ? I had it other way around.. FEC will be a doddle for ya girly if your the same as me.. just bit of indigestion & constipation so get that under control & you will be flying.. Best of luck with it all me deary... I have my last chemo next Tuesday, not sure if I told ya that ( In Churchill dog voice OH YES !! LAST CHEMO NEXT TUESDAY... he he he he.... Is there nothing that can be taken to stop it happening though ?? Thanks my lovely ladies for sharing, at least I know its just another crappy shitty s/e to put up with... Arrggghh !!! Well at least it wont last long... emmmmm.... did I mention that I have LAST CHEMO NEXT TUESDAY ??? ha ha ha ha ha ;)
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: Oh Sue my lovely friend did I forget to tell you !!! I have my LAST CHEMO next Tuesday !! Ha ha !! Do you know what, Im like a wee excited child waiting on Santa to come !! Thats how happy I am !! Tax 2.. ?!??!! Well you know exactly how that went for me !! I think thats why I feel so good now, cos I couldnt have went any lower !! So I know how you feel,,, its great isnt it !! I wish you every happiness for your hols, you soooo deserve them. Just remember to take it easy & relax. dont be taking too much out of yourself as the build up of the chemo could leave you very tired. So, enjoy every single minute of it girly !! Have a blast !! Non-alcoholic ??? What is that ??? Ha ha....Well when your over all the s/e's of the horrid T you can crack open a bottle of bubbly !! Safe travel my lovely & take care.... Patricia xxxx
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: Aw Tracey I am so very sorry to hear your news & that you are back on the rollercoaster of a ride that is breast cancer ! It is just awful that it has come back to haunt you but you stand up strong girl. You kicked its ass once & this time you just kick it twice as hard. Just wanted to let you know I am very sorry that you got this news & I hope you stay strong to get through it which I know you will !! Big big big hugs to you pet - take care xxxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer for a second time in opposite breast

Posts.Content: Try putting some chilli powder in the soups - it will help give it a bit of a kick if the tatste buds are playing up. Sprinkle the water cress on top - good way of getting it in to you !! Here's sending you big hugs n kisses for your journey ahead pet .. Stay strong xxxx
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: I wore the dark nail varnish the whole way through chemo. 2 weeks after last docetaxol I started to lose my nails - lost all 10 nails & have now lost one toe nail but in fairness when the nails did fall off the new one underneath was well grown up - was upset at the first 2 or 3 that fell off but after that I realsied no point worrying as they are growing back real quickly. Wish the eyebrows & eyelashes were as quick no sight nor light of them at all !! Hair resembles a brillo pad at the mo not a pretty sight ha ha !! But dont be worrying all that falls out or off will sooner or later come back - the sooner the better though !! Has anyone got the numb feeling in their feet ? If so when if ever does it go away?
Posts.Title: Nail problem from chemo - urgent advice please?

Posts.Content: Hi, I read that water/salad cress is excellent for boosting up your bloods. Its soo cheap to buy & I just ate it in a cracker - a little tub in Sainsburys 24 pence !! I trimmed the whole tub & just stuffed it in my mouth! My bloods were good to go for last chemo after being 0.27 so there must be something true ! Also read that any Green Veg or Red Fruit is good for bloods as well as Honey - the more natural & local the honey the better.. Good luck & hope all goes well for you xxx
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Oh poor Dorothee, I think you are understandably having a down day! We all get them and I think anything & everything you will find fault in believe me ! Tell you Mam that your thankful to have her around but your feeling bit tired, go up to your room & lock the door. You might need a good cry. Did your BC Nurse tell you she would ring today - she may just think that once the appt is made that is it. She could be out with other patients today so it may not be common practice with her to contact you. Dont worry about the food - Id say if you have tea & toast or soup or something for the next few days as that may be all you will feel like. Watch out for the bowels & indigestion. They were a real killer for me first time! All very treatable with meds. I got the little sachets to drink which didnt give you the runs just kept you going & take gaviscon for the indigestion. I had number 2 yesterday & so far so good. Im taking the gaviscon & the sachets this time as a precautionary measure ! Just tired & will prob not sleep for the next 2 nights thanks to the wonderful steroids I was given. I think its the not knowing what to expect that leaves us nervous. I dont even know what way this one will go. Oh another thing if you wake up next day & notice a lovely red glow on face & neck it is normal.. ha ha ! I looked like I had sunburn !! Its just a side effect from one of the drugs. I also found the backs of my legs quite tired & heavy. I just wanted to share with you what I had - you may get none of them. It sometimes leaves it easier if you know what you are feeling is normal. You are allowed to be cross, anxious & nervous & any other feelings you might be having. Its only you that can go through it but dont let IT get to you anymore than it already has. It has taken enough control of you & your body- thankfully your going to poison the little bastard out !! Hope you sleep well tonight pet, & if you feel like a good cry it will be a great release for you. I normally run the shower so no one can hear me !! Take care & feel free to rant away - thats why we are all here. Big hugs for tomorrow... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: aaarrgh - day before ...

Posts.Content: Hey Kelly, dont ever think you are awful for making a decision to help you get well again. It would have been "awful" to have done the trial, cured the cancer & done ir-reversible damage to your heart as you have said about family history! Your main concern is YOU & YOU GETTING BETTER & BEING CANCER FREE. The chemo will do this for you so you are doing all the right things for YOU & YOUR FAMILY!! Stay strong girlie, chin up ... Take care & every good wish & best of luck with everything xxx Patricia.
Posts.Title: Am i really awful?

Posts.Content: Hey Jules, just reading your post & you had the life in 2011 that I have in 2012 - all dates the same!! The hospital that does the rads is an 80 mile round trip every day for me which I have yet to start so am thinking will take the train to help prevent some of the tiredness ! Were you very tired after rads? Do you use anything special on your skin before rads / during / after to prevent the horrible s/e's that I have been reading ? I am so happy for you that your journey is over and you are now living a brand new life Well done girly.. you keep that lovely positive outlook ! I could be looking for a bit from ya ;) xxxx
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Hi, I am on FEC-D x 3 & DOCETAXOL x 3. I had my periods as normal all through FEC-D but stopped as soon as I went on to DOCETAXOL with no signs of it coming. I have just has 2nd of 3 DOCETAXOL & feel very hormonal ( in my head ) but no achey period pains that its on its way? SO maybe it is a build up of it all.. Im not sure...
Posts.Title: Periods during chemo

Posts.Content: Hey Girlies, I was browsing the net looking for inspiration to help put on make up with no eyelashes or eyebrows & stumbles across this on you tube. The girl doing the video is of course beautiful and makes it all very easy looking but I imagine with practice its all worth a try ! google for eyelineher.blogspot.com I actually laughed out loud when I finished watching them all cos I had a light bulb moment & in my head went "Oh ! must log on to Macmillan & let all the gals know about this" Funny how even though we are all strangers we really are a big virtual happy family As the logo says on the website We all support each other !! Please have a look gals I hope you are as impressed as me - the eyebrow one is my fave !! Havent been on here in a while ( doecetaxol ugh ) anyway I will catch up soon but in the meantime, stay strong, head up & lets all get through this together... nite nite & sweet dreams, Patricia xoxoxox
Posts.Title: FAB! Just a fab find !!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Vicki, What are your having the injections for 7 days for ? Im on second of docetaxol but only I get one injection approx 24 hours after treatment to help boost white cells... Patricia x
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Girlies, Jumping in here to see if any one has experiences hot flushes while on Docetaxol ? I had second dose today which had doseage lowered by 20% due to severe s/e's last time. I had the hot flushes last time but they seem to be a lot worse today. It was so hot & the sweat was literally running down my neck & chest & the flipping wig didnt help. I was mortified as I sat in coffee shop after treatment & smartly thought I would take a napkin & sneak it up inside the front of my wig to soak up the sweat only to pull the napkin down which GOT STUCK !! I nearly died with embarrasment so gals please do not try this in public. The napkin was soaked in sweat & refused to move. Then because I was in a panic it did not help trying to remove it ! I can have a good laugh at it now but the hot flush seemed to last an awful lot longer with that one but most of it was mortification ha ha ha !! So just wondering if its just me or is there anything you can take for it ? Thanks in advance xxx Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: CONGRATULATIONS TINKERS ! Your post is a real incentive for the rest of us who are on this journey. You have proved this is all do able even if at times I personally wonder what the hell its all about. I am so very proud of you & all you come through & I most certainly hope that most importantly you are proud of you !! You seem to be receiving an amazing follow up programme from your medical team which is great ! I wish you & your family a wonderful new life now that you have kicked cancers butt & done such a good job at it. Your Christmas this year will be a much happier one for you all. God Bless & take care you xxx Patricia ;)
Posts.Title: Finished my treatment today!

Posts.Content: Hey Louise, Just want to give you massive hugs big tight squeeeeeeezy ones OoOoOoOoOoOoOoO I know its easier said than done but maybe you should just take 2 wee sleeping tablets get an early night & sleep through it all until tomorrow - it really may not be as bad as it seems. Maybe its just a little tiny dot of it that was not zapped with the chemo & maybe you just need a stronger chemo for a few sessions. It could be just a little blip in your recovery journey. My heart truly goes out to you & Im asking for all the healing angels up there to go & help comfort you through this all.. I cant tell you what to ask because I simply dont know but Im sure you will get all the info you need at the appt. My sincere best wishes with lots of love to you on this xxxxxxx None of us know what is around any corner of our lives..
Posts.Title: don't know what the hell to think anymore : (

Posts.Content: Aw Annie I am sooooooooooooooooo happpppppppppppy for yooooooooooooooooou !!!! Am having a shit day so when I came on & read your good news I had tears of happiness for you! Aw I just delighted that things are moving in a positive way for you & I know your so relieved as well.. Everything come to those who wait ! Ha ha... Seriously though you should never have had to ! But all is going in the right direction for you now & that is all that matters.. BIG BIG BIG HUGS on their way just for you XOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOXOX
Posts.Title: never thought would be so happy to have surgery!!

Posts.Content: Hi Pollycat, Firstly, sorry you had such a horrible time... It will get better & it is do-able. Next time tell your Onc whom I presume you will meet before your next treatment & tell them your s/e's. If they feel the need they will alter your anti sickness meds. Tiredness is what got to me as well but you must listen to your body & do as it asks - Rest, rest & more rest as needed... The worst for me with the steroids was lack of sleep. I norm got around 3 hours a night which really got to me. Well I hope your feeling much better now, make sure & do something really nice & spoil yourself week before your next treatment. It will give you something to look forward to each time. Take care & stay strong... Hope you get good night sleep. ;) Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Chemo started already!

Posts.Content: Hi Abbey, I totally agree with Shelley & Karen ! It will be the best decision you make on your journey. No hoking n poking for veins. Chemo is a real frigger on your veins believe me. I had a picc line fitted which I had removed yesterday as finishes chemo wayhey & I can honestly say it was a God send. Just put all your fears to one side although on the day I got mine fitted I had your fear & then some but to be honest its more the fear of the unknown but they will not put you in any unnecessary pain. They are doing these procedures everyday so please try not worry pet. You will be back on here after its all doing saying you didnt know what you were worried about !! Best of luck with it all pet & take care, Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Worried about having a hickman line...reassurance needed please!

Posts.Content: Well guys Im now 6 days past first dose of three of Docetaxol. OMG!! Is it possible for something that is good for you to make you feel like crap! Ended up in A&E on Friday with throat that was starting to close, could not swallow, big swollen dead furry rat where my tongue used to me, infection, severe pain in ears, woeful headache, very tender finger tips (even typing this is sore) and the pains in my feet, legs and arms similar to contractions. And NO ! I am seriously not exaggerating. No taste buds, even a madarin orange felt like raw fish in my mouth. OMG !! I have never felt so sorry for myself ever ! So, I come home armed with the anti biotics, anti inflammatorys, mouth wash, drops for oral thrush, pain killers & a very very sad heart. Even have pains in my gums !!! I sailed through my procedures & honestly thought I was a good patient putting on brave front so that everyone was okay. This has really slapped me hard across the face. Has anyone else had this ? How long does it last ? I think if this is me until chemo is over Im not sure I can go through it all. Oh & just started to get a rash below my neck ! LOVELY !!! So please fellow BC buddies, can you please put my mind at ease that this will pass... We have a very important sports event that my daughter is attending in the capital at the weekend & I will be heartbroken if I feel like this- doesnt seem to matter how much pain relief I take the pain stays. Meds just leave me feeling real dopey ! Aw guys, where is the light at the end of the tunnell that I thought I saw a glimpse of (that was when I was steroid induced though) Getting very very depressed. Even my son asked me tonight was I going to die - I have to drag my feet along the floor as its so sore to lift them :( That just broke my heart so of course I locked myself in the loo & cried my heart out. Oh life just sucks at the mo !!!! Broken - hearted & lost Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Aw good morning / afternoon to all my lovely ladies who have as always been a tower of strength for me. I actually slept all night - nodded off about 2 this morning & didnt waken until just before 11 this morning & that is a first in a long time I can tell ya so even a good nights sleep helps. Im down at the unit today to get my picc line dressing changed so will have another wee chat with the nurses to see what the story is. I don't like to think that this Poison is horrible to a lot of people but it is somewhat very selfishly comforting when you know your not alone on this sh1t journey! You gals are amazing support - no matter what hour of the day coming on here & being able to rant & rave really does help ;) Taking the tramadol has really helped with the pain but it does leave me feeling bit dopey on it ?!??!! Got the Laxido sachets from FEC last time so thanks gals, will take it to help with constipation, Cant remember when I last went to the loo ! YIKES !! Too much info ??? Ha ha... But ya know your in the right place when even talking about things like that dont embarrass you. Well here's hoping you all have a lovely day & thanks for everything as always... Take care & will let you know how I get on today, Big hugs to you all Patricia xx oo xx oo
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: RIGHT ! DOCETAXOL LETS BE HAVING YA !! DO YOUR WORST !!! For a girl who created this discussion who hates Docetaxol with a passion I am dying to have it flow through my veins tomorrow cos it will be my LAST CHEMO !! I just had to let you all know girlies JUST INCASE I forgot to tell yas all... ha ha ha ha !! Seriously hope all this messing isnt going to jinx me !! So, please God my bloods are up to standard & I can get going ! Early appt 9-30 am - earliest one yet .. is that a good thing or bad thing ?? Mmmmmmmm..... anyway, will let you all know how it goes, good or bad but it has to be good ! Positive Thinking ! Im hyper tonight with the steroids as well which may explain why Im going off on one... Well, gone to see if I can get some shut eye... Chat to you all very soon.... Best of luck to anyone having treatment today & to all who had it today, stay strong, the s/e's are only a few days out of our lives ;) Take care all .... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hey Shelley, Caroline & all my buddies ! I am chemo free ! Yes LAST CHEMO TODAY !! Wayhey !! I was a nervous wreck going in as I was sneezing all night & having mad hot flushes so was afraid my bloods might not be right or my temp was up or that aliens had landed & stole the chemo unit ! But no ! Good luck was for once going my way !! But thank the Lord, the horrible hateful evil Docetaxol went aflowing through my veins & I cherished every moment knowing it was the last one ! Yes, will never have to sit in a big armchair or lie in a bed in a chemo unit again ( please God, fingers, toes & all other bits crossed ) Even got my picc line removed as my Onc said would not be needed after today so that really made me believe all was good ! So as far as the horrid s/e's to follow well they wont really kick in until Thur eve or Friday so until then Im going to make the most of it - apart from the streroids stealing my sleep at the mo ! Wonder would it be safe to go out for a meal & few glassed of vino tomorrow evening. I will have taken all my steroids by tomorrow evening along with anit sickness tabs that last up until Friday & I have to get my Neulasta jab tomorrow as well... so what do you reckon girlies... Would I be mad to have a few drinks with my mates to celebrate last chemo tomorrow eve or should I wait until week after next as that will be when I will feel normal again please God... Thanks in advance my lovelies for your advice & hope anyone who had chemo today or the rest of the week that it all goes as good as can be expected for you all.. Just incase by the time you read to the end of this post you may have forgotten.................................... I HAD MY LAST CHEMO TODAY !!! YIPPPPPPPPPPPPPPEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE !!!! Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Julie ! Have I got an owl partner ?? Thought I was the only owl that was up last night & yes Im still up ha ha!! Well done you on getting off the chemo bus its an amazing feeling isnt it so HUGE CONGRATS TO YOU GIRLY !!! I think you have twisted my arm - I was going to go in to work today but think I may take it easy today & be fit to go out tonight as Im sure after tomorrow my demonic shadow shall haunt me again for days with the horrid s/e's so you are so right ! Was just a bit afraid with the vino end of things but feck it your right !!! Oh no, the runs are not good - what date was your last treatment, I never had that s/e - usually the other for me !! Hope your feeling an awful lot better today & that the worst is over you now please God !! I got my date for rads - starting Mon 1st Oct & ending Fri 2nd Nov so its working out well - just a month when you look at it just the way Oct goes this year. 5 days a week for 5 weeks !! Take care Julie & let me know how your getting on me deary,, Patricia xoxoxo
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Gals & All Fellow Docetaxol Haters !! Im just popping by very quickly to say hope you are all coping okay. My last dose on Tuesday has knocked me for 6! Yep Im now calling it the Docetaxol Dumper Truck ! It had a hit out on me, got me ran me over & had left me for dead ! I can just about type this - taking forever going back & correcting all mistakes - putting one foot in front of the other is a job & half - even have all the pains in legs & feet while lying down. Then Im too warm, put the fan on - then Im too cold put on more layers - then back again !! Oh sweet divine !! This is not even funny !! Have an awful sore throat, the tongue is getting bigger by the hour ! Can I possibly barge any more ! OMG !! I am almost finished a bottle of the Nystatin hubby thinks there is drugs in it & Im addicted ha ha !! Oh we have to laugh dont we ! Well I have not managed to catch up on any posts as I have been sleeping most of the time from Wed night but when I am normal again I will get back on track & see how you are all keeping. I have been rinsing & gargling with hot water & salt which has seemd to ease a bit ( just in case some might like to try ) Well take care everyone & im off to sleep for the weekend, catch up real soon... All of you enjoy the weekend, I dont care its raining here so good enough excuse to go back to bed ha ha !! All the best & lots of love, Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jellytot, I personally have the bone pain all the time & only get one injection day after chemo but they do say the injections do increase the bone pain - bummer I know but worth it to keep your blood count good ! I know exactly how you feel but I was saying exactly this to my Onc today & she said the best cure for it was to keep walking that exercise was best medicine for the achey legs & feet ! Sound stupid & I did actually say this but she said it was the best thing for it !! So I have been pushing myself more today with the walking - tough but if it helps will be worth it. Hope your feeling better really soon pet - I guess by now you know my opinion on the poison but I had my last one today & even though my s/e's were shit looking back it is all do-able ! Take care hun & let me know how you are getting on.. Stay strong my deary... Lots of love n hugs.... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Suzie, I will do my best now to obey your orders ha ha ha !! Thanks for the reassurance, oooh the pain in my arm from all the twisting ha ha ha !! Have a lovely day pet.. Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Kirstie, I was beginning to think I was a useless weakling - would never make a druggie ! Ha ha... I dont even like taking sleeping tablets but the tramadol seems to do that job as well... Im actually smiling as Im writing this so that HAS to be a good sign.. Well better head here & get ready for the hospital. Have to get picc dressing changed.. Chat soon & thanks for everything.. MWAH !! P. xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Well Gals, Im back in the land of the living! I went to hospital on Monday where I was admitted with high temp & literally non-existant white blood cell count! Came out in horrible red itchy sore rash along the top of my chest. Had throad closing in, sores with severe dryness in my nose, oral thrush, thrush down below and severe pain in my feet leaving that I could not walk very far. They put me on IV anti biotics there & then. Was then sent for chest x-ray. Had loads of swab tests & blood tests & blood cultures done. Monday was a very surreal scary experience for me & I spent most of Monday night crying myself to sleep. The nurses were lovely & let hubby stay unitl well after 11 but he had work the next day & had to sort the kids out as well. So I was discharged yesterday with a bag full of drugs that left me fearing I may get mugged by some druggie ha ha !! It took a while for bloods to come up as they were so dangerously low & the high temp was hard to stabilise so had fan on my locker 24-7 while I was in. So Im back home & they never found out where the infection was but said that was quite common to never know where the infection was! Well Im home again anyway & thats the main thing. My Onc. popped over to me on Tues. & said she would "tweak" the next dose - I only have 2 more to go & Im not as scared now knowing what can be expected, I just took a really really bad reaction to it which does not happen everyone - I just wanted to prepare & warn people what can happen & not to be frightened by it all. Then I come out of the shower today & notice where a stitch was left in by a drain (which I showed to 2 Doc's & both said it would go away by itself - had surgery done end of April.. this is now mid Aug?? who am I to question a doc??) anyway to find puss coming out of it! Lovely! So I kinda squeezed what I could & washed around it again & now just keep putting sudocrem on it all the time. Im now wondering would this have been the source of the infection & should I contact a doctor about this. Its just that Im only home & really dont want to have to face a hospital again !! So what do I do ? just keep the sudocrem on it. there is no pain at all from it ! Weird !! Some people had these s/e's on FEC which I breezed through so it proves we are all different people just fighting the same war !! So I hope you are all keeping okay since I was last on here girlies.. stay strong & keep fighting !! Big hugs to you all & best of luck to anyone getting treatments today... Hope you all have a wonderful weekend & enjoy the wonderful sunshine... Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline, sounds all normal to me - it could be bit of fluid which will go away eventually. If it does get painfully unbearable they may drain it for you ( again all normal ) Keep the arm moisturised & bio oil on the scars & do the exercises you are allowed to do for the time frame from surgery - this may also help. If the swelling is not too painful to touch even massaging it with some moisturiser may even help ! I am still swollen from April but I had Ld flap as well so was told it was normal too - Hope your feeling better real soon pet - take care pet. Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: large swelling around node incision

Posts.Content: First of all Shelley, congrats on getting over the Chemo!! You defo have the worst bit done believe me!!Best of luck for the op on Thursday - it will all be fine and you will be back on your feet in no time.. Dont bring any perfumed products as these can not be used where node removal is so bring Simple washing products - no deodorant on that side Im afraid & I was so paranoid about that (ok on good side) so bring some nice perfumes or body sprays that you can spray on your pjs - defo button down pj tops so much easier with drains and when surgeon comes in to check on wounds etc.. - Johnsons are doing lovely new lavender wipes that smell gorg bring something like that to keep your hands, face etc refreshed during the day. Not sure how long you will be in as I had 8.5 hours op of mastectomy, full node removal & ld flap all in one op so Im in a different bus to you - but if your any for any length, bring the dry shampoo spray & get someone to put it in for you it was a God send for me as I was in for 7 days. Drains are grand honest dont be worrying - they wont come out ! Do bring face cloths & towels ( get someone to bring in fresh ones daily to save space in your bag! Send home all washing each day as well. Keeps the bag empty as possible for going home. DRINK DRINK DRINK LOADS OF WATER - this really helps with the healing process of your wounds, flushes out the anaesthetci & keeps your skin from drying up. Watch out for constipation which is caused by pain relief - nurse told me to drink hot water & kiwis in the morning & I swear it worked ! I could not settle to read books either but found magazines easier to flick through. Bring in mints as well, keeps your mouth refreshed. Bring in a wee fleecy blanket to keep the mastectomy warm - helps with healing - OH maybe that is just for recon wounds though - But I was told to bring warm fleecy blanket to keep wound warm for good blood flow. But that could be for the recon ld flap... Cant think of anything else so all I can do now is send you very best of luck for the op ! you will be grand. Big hugs xoxoxo Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Scheduled for MX on Friday - a few questions

Posts.Content: Has anyone tried out the chillow ? Im getting bit peed off with the hot head at night time switching the pillow around to cool down.... Ive seen them on amazon & there seems to be a few different types So any advise would be great my friends Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: Chillow - any good ?

Posts.Content: Ha ha Clare !! Well did you do as promised ?? Ha ha.. Yeah Im seriously thinking of investing in one just wasnt sure if they were the real deal. I was looking at them on Amazon - where did you get yours & is yours a certain make ? See you can get mini ones as well which I think would be cool to have in the car !!  Do you have to store it in the fridge at all ? Im just trying to make sure to be sure... Thanks pet xxx
Posts.Title: Chillow - any good ?

Posts.Content: When I was recovering from surgery my cousin gave me Catherine Tate box sets U& Gavin & Stacey box sets so funny ! Also gave me Prison Break box sets which I had never watched before - the eye candy alone is good ! My fav films are... Coyote Ugly Pretty Woman Dear John JFK Pearl Harbour All of the Bourne movies (more eye candy there) Sex & The City Grease ! Dirty Dancing My Girl (though tears may flow eek) Did you ever watch Girl With The Dragon Tatoo ( bit rough in places but an amazing story - you woul really get engrossed in that one) Even some of the kid movies like Avatar Babe 1 & 2 (guilty pleasure) All of the Twilight movies so addicted to them I got the lot !! More eye candy ha ha !! Well hope you can pick some good ones but I know what you mean - hubby came home Sunday night to find me in floods of tears watching My Sisters Keeper (AGAIN) Even had read the book long before the film came out. I swear I literally went through full box of tissues ! Got to the stage hadnt a feckin clue what I was crying about - but that is me I even cry at X Factor auditions so I guess Im a lost cause! Take care me lovely & makes a change writing good stuff ! Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: The Film Thread

Posts.Content: Hello Kelly, Hope your feeling a bit better today. Every single emotion you are experiencing is normal I promise. We all get carried away with it all thinking its really got it in for us ! I had a wobble the other day as well ! So please dont be apologising its what we are all here for. To know that we are not alone in the horrible journey or with any of the symptoms or emotions. Its good to cry, get it all out of our systems. Even if you have to go to the bathroom, sit in the shower & let it all out. God there was one time I done that I howled like a wolf !! I swear !! But there are so many emotions we have to go through & none of us no what is the correct way to handle it but thats because there is no correct way just your way ! So you dont be beating yourself up about how your feeling your you !! And your family love just you ! No point in worrying about something we have absolutely no control over - this was something told to me at the start of my crap journey & I keep telling myself this. Hope your okay pet & stay strong - Dont let IT get the better of ya sweetheart Big big hugs going your way Patricia xxxx
Posts.Title: Is it normal to be feeling like this?

Posts.Content: Hi Sharon - all you are experiencing is totally normal ! I had all my nodes removed in April & I would still be numb so dont be worrying. Guess we just have to get used to it - small price to pay & all that. The exercises defo help - I do them religiously every day, Remember to moisturise your arm massaging the creme in moving always upwards from your wrist into your shoulder blade - NEVER down the ways ( to prevent lymphodema) & put bio oil on the scar. I find doing the exercise just after I do this really helps. So this is just my experience but have been told by surgeon totally normal so hope this helps put your mind at ease. It really is the not knowing which I find is the worst about all this. Take care pet & hope all goes well for you on your journey. We are all here for each other xxx Patricia xxx
Posts.Title: numbness after node removal

Posts.Content: Hi Purple Heart, I am sincerley sorry that you have found yourself on this site to help your partner - I hope they are coping okay. I personally would never tell other people what to do in this matter as every person & situation is different & I am sure they have their reasons - their Mam being one of them. I have one session of chemo left but I have a young family so I really wanted to fire all I could at the hateful cancer !! I will then go for rads as well - At lease if the little fecker ever ever dares rear its ugly little head again I will be content knowing that I done all I could. But this is only my outlook on it & if I were in your partners shoes or anyone elses for that matter the decisions may well have been different. So sorry I cant help but what I really wanted to say was I think your partner is a very very lucky person to have someone so thoughtful in her life to come on to the site on their behalf. You first post really touched my heart & actually at first made me a little jealous as my hubby treated my cancer like a toothace and the chemo as a filling of a tooth ! So when I see someone who has such love & respect like yours it really touched me. They are one very lucky person & I hope they know this - show them this message from me !! Ha ha !! Anyway, whatever their decision is, you just being by their side to support them is all they will need. I wish you both every pray with the best of luck on your journey ahead. God Bless you both & take care, Patricia xx
Posts.Title: in search of wise words..

Posts.Content: Hi Beckie, I would defo go to A&E or your doctor on call. Your poor thing should not have to go through this. Perhaps they could insert a drain for you seeing the fluid is collecting all the time. Do not suffer pet, go & get it sorted. Hope all is okay with you. Best of luck xxx
Posts.Title: Seroma after mastectomy with Temp breast implant

Posts.Content: I rang 5 weeks ago & got an appt for 4th September so I would advise ringing them asap as the courses seems to fill up pretty quick. The nearest hospital to me that does it is almost 1.5 hours away. I booked it & am going on my own ! Seem to have become quite brave since "C" dared to rear its ugly head in to my life ( guess thats one good thing to have come out of it all ) So defo book it - We are worth a bit of a pampering session after all the sh1t thats been fired at us ! You go girl !! Enjoy & really hope you get an appt really soon.... xxx
Posts.Title: Look good feel better
